alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 1:48PM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MONDAY TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow...and some blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph Monday night. Dangerous wind chills as low as 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon County including Baggs, Rawlins, Saratoga, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From 5 AM Monday to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions possible due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Cold temperatures could lead to frostbite and hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
